• Padric watches helplessly as Aisling falls, screaming. She slams into the rocks far below. Padric watches in horror as her body washes away into the ocean.

• Nightingale backs away slowly as the others corner her. Desperate, Nightingale goes for a knife on her own belt and moves to jam it into her own neck, but Rook takes her to the ground with a vicious tackle before the suicidal blow can be delivered.
• Nightingale thrashes in Rook’s arms. Remi approaches her, horrified that Nightingale did something so reckless to try and save her.

• Remi comforts Nightingale until the Maluma finally relinquished its hold and rolls back deep within her. The ordeal of clawing her own consciousness back to the surface of her psyche leaves Nightingale shaken. As she regains control of her body the organic armor and weapon vanish back inside of her.
• Nightingale sobs into Remi’s shoulder, shaken by the ordeal.
• Zeke picks up the Hegemonix in the grass triumphantly. Padric only scoffs at him, angry that they killed Aisling.

title: Sneaking Into The Crime Scene
content: • Not far from Malik’s manor, the four begin to discuss the best course of action. During their debate, Nightingale hears the Maluma whisper inside of her head once more. It claims that it knows how to find the one responsible for the murder and if she would allow it to take control of her body, the Maluma would lead her there.

• Nightingale’s resistance to the Maluma wanes but nevertheless, she holds strong. Nightingale screams at the Maluma to stop trying to manipulate her. Her sudden outburst at seemingly nothing causes the group to worry about Nightingale’s mental health.

• Seeing the urgency slowly starting to manifest itself in Nightingale’s physical and mental appearances, Remi decides to find the crime scene herself. By asking around town, the four are able to find the scene of the murder. It ends up being a small house in the poorer district of the city.

• The group hides outside of the house and stakes the place out until nightfall. Strangely, the building isn’t guarded by the city watch and is instead being stalked by two of Malik’s guards in black. Remi admits that these men are her fathers goons and they call themselves the Black Hand. Zeke’s suspicions that Malik was a bit of a villain are confirmed by this. Remi berates him, defending her father’s integrity. Then she takes charge of the situation, leaving the others behind to watch as she convinces the guards to leave.

• Once the coast is clear, the group enters the informants house and stumble upon the gruesome murder scene. The Informant seems to have been literally splattered about the room. Whatever killed him did it in a spectacular fashion and couldn’t have been done by non-magical means.

• The group searches the scene. Rook finds a black ledger that details a list of artifacts. Suri appears to confirm that these are stolen property from the dead. Each one a dark name from Arkalla that had been killed and had their belongings stolen. Rook comes to the conclusion that this was a ledger of artifacts that Malik had likely been peddling. Remi defends her father, but the evidence against him surmounts as Rook clearly finds transactions being tracked.

• A noise from below them alerts the group to the presence of something beneath them. Together, the four search, finding a hidden trap door that leads into the cellar below the house. Down below, in the darkness, a strange woman contorts in inhuman ways and attacks them.

title: Someone’s There
content: • With the monsters defeated, the group begins to celebrate. Remi catches sight of someone standing behind shrubbery in the distance. At first she’s worried that the figure was a victim of the explosion, but her concern quickly vanishes when the silhouette darts into the nearby forest.
• Realizing the figure might be the culprit, Remi dashes forward, hoping to catch the figure before they can escape.
• After a short chase, Remi is able to use her natural ability to fly to catch the man with a tackle. The two tumble to the ground and Remi freezes when she hears the click of a gun.
• The man forces her back at gunpoint. While being held with her hands up, Remi is able to see the man’s striking facial features and scars.
• Luckily, Nightingale, Rook, and Zeke arrive just in time and force the man to retreat.
• The unknown assailant escapes, but Remi is left unscathed and with a description to give her father.
• For the second time in two days Remi finds herself back in her father’s study.
• Remi excitedly explains what happened. Admitting to her father that they didn’t go to the guards for help but they were able to handle it by themselves.
• Remi gives Malik the description of the man that they saw, describing his strikingly unique features and long scar on his face.

• Malik’s expression darkens at the description of the man. He admits that he knows who was behind the attack but refuses to let them get caught up any further in his personal issues. Malik’s temper is withheld so much that he has to tell Remi that he isn’t angry at her. Instead, he’s angry at the man who pointed a gun at his daughter. Regardless, Malik is happy that his daughter is okay. Malik hugs Remi and thanks the others for watching her back before sending them away with a promise that he’ll contact them as soon as he knows more about the whereabouts of a Theodotion Mage.
• ! New Story Flag: Culprit Identified.

title: Spend That Gold
content: • Just as her father instructed, Remi stops by her house to grab her gear before they depart Rhamsted.
• She finds the Black Hand hard at work cleaning up what’s left of the Moretti estate.
• Mia, the steward, invites her inside and shows her to her bedroom.

• After grabbing her gear, as Remi turns to leave she sees a box on her bed. She might have not seen it at all if it hadn’t meowed. Above the box she finds a note written in Malik’s dense handwriting. It reads, “Congratulations on graduating, I wanted to get you something Special, and remember you saying how much you missed your cat from earth. I brought him home for you. Don’t tell anyone. Love, Dad.”
• Inside, Remi finds a fantastic version of her cat from Earth. Gage had apparently passed through the advancement just like her and gained supernatural abilities.
• ! Reward: Remi has reunited with her pet from Earth. In addition, Remi regains her old equipement.

title: Stop Her!
content: • Aisling stumbles from a deep gash in her side. Defeated, she staggers and drops to her knees.

• Seeing that they have been defeated, Nightingale goes for a knife on her belt and moves to jam it into her own neck, but Rook takes her to the ground with a vicious tackle before the suicidal blow can be delivered.
• With Nightingale incapacitated by Rook, Padric tries to talk Aisling down as she backs away.
• Aisling, still under the impression that Nightingale is acting on her own, refuses to surrender. She pulls the Hegemonix from a satchel, intending to use it.

• As Aisling clicks the mechanisms of the Hegemonix into place, Remi sees that Padric is frozen, unable to bring himself to stop her. Remi charges at Aisling in an attempt to take her to the ground before she can activate the Hegemonix.
• ! Flag Check: Does the party have the Story Flag Leg Wound?

title: Struggling To Get There
content: • As the creatures bore down on the party, the Maluma nearly falls from the cliffs before lashing out from Nightingale’s palms and devouring them. Even though Nightingale suffered a nasty cut, the Maluma seemed unphased by the pain. Instead, it looks nervous from the close call with death from falling.

• Seeing it’s nervousness for the first time, Rook can’t help but wonder that the Maluma would have nowhere to go if it died in a body that fell that distance. Perhaps the Great Bounty would claim it after all?

title: Thanks anyway
content: • With the last of their attackers either fleeing or dead on the ground, they are free to assess the damage. Padric walks slowly between them, unable to completely restrain his hope that someone had managed to find his shotgun. But of course, they didn’t. It was lost.
• Padric thanks them all for their help, even if they failed to find his shotgun. Padric promises a reward of sorts regardless and the group returns safely to Rhamsted.
• ! Special: Padric offers a discount for your help.

title: The Grace Of Rhamsted
content: • The group is dragged to the Rhamsted palace in irons.
• When they arrive, they find Malik and Grace together in the throne room. Grace chastises the guards for locking up royalty and has the irons removed before apologizing to Zeke.

• Malik and Grace demand an explanation as they have eye witness accounts that the five of them were seen leaving the murder scene in flames. Zeke quickly defends their actions, telling them that it wasn’t them. He points the finger at Aisling, explaining that she was torching the place to hide evidence and cover her tracks.
• Remi also backs the story up, angrily condemning her father for using Melody as a deterrent for others who might attempt to break in.
• Malik and Grace seem relieved to hear that they weren’t the ones destroying evidence. But the relief is quickly replaced with anger at the realization that Aisling is the one behind the murder.

• Malik and Grace argue over what to do about Aisling and the group learns that Malik had warned Grace long ago about Aisling being hell bent on revenge. Apparently, Grace hadn’t taken him seriously and no action was taken the first time she was warned by Malik.

• Their open display of teamwork shows Padric that Aisling was probably right the whole time, these two were in league. Padric makes a snide comment to Grace about letting someone like Malik in on such official business. Grace only threatens him, making it clear that his friendship with Shayliss is the only reason Padric’s still able to run his mouth the way he does. Furthermore, Grace promises that if he intervenes with their pursuit of Aisling that Grace will have him tried all the same.
• Padric is rudely dismissed. He bows respectfully to Grace before leaving, making sure to make eye contact with Nightingale before finally leaving the throne room.

• Grace and Malik decide to take action against Aisling while keeping Nightingale and her friends away from causing anymore trouble. Nightingale, Remi, Zeke and Rook all protest, claiming there is a bigger threat that needs to be taken care of but Grace has none of it. She tells them that they’ll be staying in the castle until Balthazar comes to fetch them.

title: The One That Got Away
content: • Defeated, Nightingale slumps against the wall as the monster woman advances on her.
• Remi yells, trying to distract the monster before it can kill Nightingale. The monster woman turns on Remi and bears down on her.

• In a moment of desperation, Nightingale is coerced by the Maluma into giving up her body to save Remi’s life. With her friend screaming and in danger, Nightingale sees no alternative and accepts the Maluma’s offer.

• The Maluma takes ahold of Nightingale’s body and ushers in incredible strength. Nightingale is controlled like a puppet as a horrific maw opens from her palms and spits forth a wave of grotesque mouths. Only moments away from making a killing blow against Remi, the monster woman is caught in the multitude of mouths and thrashed about, suffering grievous damage to her body.

• The monster woman screams and backs away in fear as the Maluma looms above her with a wide maw. Feeling the Maluma’s malicious intent on consuming the woman whole, Nightingale fights with all of her might to force the Maluma back inside of her palms. Nightingale is able to regain control as the Maluma disappears, it’s massive mouth snapping and raging as it’s sucked back into her palms.

• True to its word, the Maluma let her have her body back… or was it it Nightingale that forced the Maluma back inside of her? Nightingale isn’t sure, but regardless, Remi is safe, the monster Woman is incapacitated and Nightingale feels pretty good about herself.
• ! New Story Flag & Reward: Slipping. Nightingale’s encounter with the Maluma learns her a new Discipline.

title: The Perpetrator’s Hideout
content: • In distress and panicking, Remi sprints out of the cave. To Remi’s relief, her friends have come for her. Zeke catches her before she can fall to the ground from exhaustion and pain.
• Remi screams out a warning as Aisling comes sprinting out of the cave just behind her.
• Aisling skids to a stop, frozen in surprise that the group was able to find her hideout. In, one hand she holds the Hegemonix and there is no mistaking the power radiating from the artifact.
• Aisling curses at Padric, thinking he has betrayed her by helping the group find her hideout.
• Padric tries to talk sense into Aisling, but it does no good.

• Aisling knows she cant bring her father back, but she can honor him by bringing justice to those who wronged him. By punishing those responsible, Aisling is only taking what’s rightfully hers. Kidnapping Remi and stealing her away from Malik would force him to feel loss, just like she had.
• Before the verbal fight can escalate any further, the Maluma cuts them both off with a shrill laugh. Using Nightingale’s body, it shoves Remi down into the dirt and mud.

• Hurt and confused, Remi watches as Nightingale joins Aisling’s side. Emulating Nightingale, the Maluma claims that she too cares about Elenia and bringing justice to Malik and Grace. Nightingale promises Aisling that they shall both have what’s rightfully theirs.
• Believing that the Princess of Elenia has her back, Aisling gears up for a fight.
• Zeke curses at the Maluma, calling it a liar. Then he explains to Remi that the Maluma is in control.

• Nightingale laughs as a sort of organic armor latches to her body. The Maluma forges a weapon made from the biology of it’s own sick body. It forms a grotesque sword and a set of armor that engulfs Nightingale. Then, without any further discussion, the Maluma and Aisling charge forward.
• Rook yells out, instructing that nobody hurts the Princess. Rook knows that the Maluma is looking for a new body and he won’t be tricked.
• With a renewed strength and purpose, Remi picks herself up and draws her daggers. She wasn’t going to let Aisling or the Maluma hurt her friends.

title: The Shortest Path
content: • Staying safe by sticking to the road takes the group on a hot walk beneath refreshing shade. After sometime, Nightingale hears a waterfall and Padric smiles knowing that his shotgun is close.
• With advice to take it slow and be careful, Padric draws his weapon and the group follows suit, slowly advancing towards the waterfall.

title: Too Broke To Play
content: • Charlotte berates the group for being too poor to play, seeing as how she’s heard that they’re royalty of sorts according to Padric.
• Before Charlotte can make too much of a scene Padric steps in and offers to let them play for free.

title: Victorious Aisling
content: • Remi collapses physically and emotionally from their defeat.

• Aisling taunts Remi, thinking that the youngest Princess of Elenia has her back. Aisling leans in close to Aisling and promises that she is going to take her back to Elenia and have her entire corrupt family punished for their crimes.
• Aisling is suddenly struck in the back of the head by a vicious blow from Nightingale.
• Controlled by the Maluma, Nightingale delivers a second horrible blow that sends Aisling crumpling to her knees.
• Through her delirium, and unaware that Nightingale has been controlled by a parasite this whole time, Aisling is confused by her actions. She coughs blood and falls to the dirt.
• Remi looks on in horror and confusion as the Maluma looms over Aisling.
• Padric tries in vain to pull himself up in an attempt to stop Nightingale from delivering a fatal blow to Aisling.
• Nightingale only laughs, taking the Hegemonix from the grass nearby Aisling. Nightingale clicks the puzzle box into place and unleashes the Exalted Esper inside.
• Aisling croaks out a warning in fear and pain. The Hegemonix was not to be trifled with and only Aisling truly knew what it would unleash.

title: We’re Close
content: • Rook tosses the last dead Fragor from the cliffside, watching its body tumble far below.

• They ask the Maluma if they can have Nightingale back, but the Maluma claims that it promised them the murderer. Until then, Nightingale will stay under its control. The Maluma promises that they are almost upon the cave.
• Sure enough, the cave entrance was just ahead. It was a jagged wound in a cliff that was constantly bleeding rainwater.
• To his surprise, Rook could just make out the outline of someone running towards the exit from within.

title: What To Do With Her?
content: • Remi slams into Aisling moments before she’s able to use the Hegemonix.
• Aisling goes sprawling and the Hegemonix goes over the cliffside.
• Remi kicks off the ground and dives after it, narrowly catching the Hegemonix before crashing into the rocks below.
• Unarmed and wounded, Aisling accepts defeat. Padric rushes to her side and comforts her. He quickly begins treating the terrible wounds she suffered from the fight.
• Nightingale thrashes in Rook’s arms. Remi approaches her, horrified that Nightingale did something so reckless to try and save her.

• Remi comforts Nightingale until the Maluma finally relinquished its hold and rolls back deep within her. The ordeal of clawing her own consciousness back to the surface of her psyche leaves Nightingale shaken. As she regains control of her body the organic armor and weapon vanish back inside of her.
• Nightingale sobs into Remi’s shoulder, shaken by the ordeal.

• The group moves back into the cave to take cover from the storm and enjoy a moment of respite. Once inside, Zeke goes through the bag that Remi took from Aisling. Luckily, the Information Broker did in fact find what they needed. There was details about a Theodotion user traveling with a cult called The Anointed. The group was last seen in the city of Hyde.
• Excited, Rook explains that Hyde is only a couple days walk. If they left Rhamsted tonight, they’d cover that ground in no time.

• The group agrees. And despite being locked in the tower by Grace, the events that had just transpired were important enough that Grace needed to know that they handled it. And in anycase, Remi wasn’t going to leave without making sure her father was alive and okay.
• But there was still one more issue to be resolved. Remi wasn’t going to let Aisling off the hook. Angry at what she’d been put through, Remi has little remorse for Aisling.

• Padric on the other hand, seems to be more of an apologist, even going as far as trying to diffuse the situation all together. Remi angrily tells Padric that they should take her back to Malik and Grace and have them sort it out. It’s their city after all, and with the only thing Grace really cares about taken care of, she would have no reason to keep them locked up anymore.

• Aisling pleads. Claiming that she only fought them because she thought the Princess of Elenia had her back. Aisling worries that if they take her back to Grace that she wont get a fair trial and they’ll simply have her punished or even executed.

• Padric agrees. He doesn’t see taking Aisling back to Malik or Grace as a true form of justice. Instead, he recommends that they let him take Aisling to the capital of Elenia for a proper trial. That way, the Arsen and Jeong family can decide for themselves what needs to be done about the mess.

• Remi still doesn’t like it. Moreover, she’s worried that any action against Aisling could put her father in real danger. King Balthazar didn’t have a reputation for being kind on criminals either. If they were all unlucky he’d have Aisling, Grace, and Malik executed.
• Padric doesn’t disagree, but he still stands by his plan. He wants to give Aisling a chance to explain herself to the King.
• It’s made clear that regardless of the decision, Remi, Rook, and Zeke feel that Grace and Malik should know what happened.
• ! Decision: The players must make a decision.

title: Your Plan Sucks
content: • Beaten back, the party hides nearby and regroups.
• Zeke comes up with a plan and throws a rock to distract the creatures before darting forward towards the cave.
• ! Special: The noise from the stone distracts the monsters.

title: A Brother’s Advice
content: • At first Shayliss is filled with joy as her vision opens during a wedding. There is the woman she loves, waiting.
• But it isn’t her wedding, it’s Tyrial and Abigail’s. She realizises then she’s being manipulated, and she flees from the vision, running out onto the balcony.
• Her dead older brother Dominic is waiting for her. She tries to persuade him not to go on the trip that gets him killed, but realizes swiftly that she can’t do anything to change the past.
• The coffin is honest with her, revealing that it’s feeding on her mind and soul. It insists that the way people die on trips with Balthazar isn’t a coincidence.
• ! Flag Check: Coffin Buddy
• Gage wakes Remi before sunrise. She dismisses his worries at first, but he’s too insistent for her to go back to sleep, and he leads her out of the bedroom.
• She discovers the Anointed sneaking out of the palace. After following them for long enough to be sure of their intentions, she hurries back to wake everyone.
• The group mobilizes as quickly as they can, with everyone certain of where the Anointed will be going.
• ! Special: Zafir is Unselectable
• ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

• Nightingale leads the way, the first to fight whatever they encounter. She’s not afraid anymore, the Maluma floats around beside her every moment. Compared to the parasite strangling her soul, how can any monster frighten her?
• The Shadow Lord appears after a little while, expressing surprise they’re still alive. It mentions casually that the ‘others’ down in the depths are trying to get killed just as hard.
• Nightingale says that she doesn’t care if they get killed, they deserve it for breaking the Aegis stone. Even so, she asks where they are.
• The Shadow Lord finally takes notice of the Maluma, remarking that it’s going to win two souls from her.
• Nightingale asks more respectfully, and this time the Shadow Lord answers. It appreciates the work of a serial killer, considering her a fellow craftsman.
• The group is left to decide whether or not to follow the Shadow Lord’s instructions and find Zafir, or leave him to die.
• ! Special: Decide to obey the Shadow Lord, or not abandon the blood trails.
• The Soul Butchers are far too powerful, and they’re forced to flee.
• Shayliss manages to get a side door open, but not before someone is badly wounded. They stumble out, barring the door behind them.
• ! Special: Zeke is Injured

• Nightingale is unable to make the decision, but Rook can tell what he wants to tell him. It’s his time to make a sacrifice. He makes the decision for her, so that she doesn’t have to feel guilty about his life.
• Suri appears to try and convince him to stop, furious with grief. But she can’t talk him out of it. Rook gives the pendant to Nightingale, asking Suri to take care of everyone when he’s gone.
• Suri rages against the Shadow Lord for a moment, ineffectively, before vanishing.
• The Shadow Lord is appeased by the grief and pain they’ve felt, and kills Rook right in front of him. It accepts the payment, and offers them Justice.
• ! New Story Flag: A New Owner
• ! Special: Rook has been killed
• Damocles wakes surrounded by the broken wreckage of the coffin, lying aching on his back. The visions he saw in the coffin still torture him.
• Nightingale is there to bring him back to reality, and explain what he missed.
• Damocles explains to everyone that before the coffin was destroyed, he saw some of its memories. The bloody trail they saw earlier is the key to finding Justice.
• ! Special: Damocles is no longer Unselectable
• Damocles wakes outside in the sun, though the haunting vision of his dead mother is fresh in his mind.
• Nightingale is there beside him, to help bring him back to reality and explain that the coffin was feeding on him, he wasn’t in the real world.
• The group does their best to catch him on what he missed, and explain how they got outside.
• ! Special: Damocles is no longer Unselectable
• Nightingale refuses to trade anyone. She declines the offer and demands Justice back anyway.
• The Shadow Lord is disappointed its offer has been refused, but consoles itself that it will have all their souls now instead of one.
• Abigail and Tyrial greet Padric with excitement, obviously old friends. They don’t seem to care much about royal formality.
• Things are tenser for Shayliss and Abigail, who are tense and awkward around each other.
• Shayliss introduces Nightingale, and the two fawn over her for a moment.
• ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership
• Justice says that if they reassemble the Pontifex with all three pieces, she could use it to seal the Maluma into a new body. But she doesn’t know where they could actually find a willing host.
• After some debate, it is decided that Shayliss, Zeke and Padric will be traveling to Arkalla to replace the Aegis stone.
• Nightingale, Remi, Rook, Damocles, and Justice will go to the vaults to get the last piece of the pontifex.
• ! Party Check: Is Zafir in the party?
• After a terrible fight, they’re finally able to defeat the Soul Butcher.
• They don’t stay for long, as the sound of more creatures echoes thorugh the halls. The Pixies return, guiding them to a hasty escape before more butchers arrive.

• Shayliss stops the group after walking a long while, horrified by what she’s discovered. She rages that Justice is lost and there’s nothing they can do. Her map didn’t show it, but now that she’s here she recognizes the spot.

• Shayliss explains that Justice is trapped beyond the protection of the Aegis stone, an ancient and powerful protection put in place by Lo Jeong. It’s the only thing keeping Greyhaven safe from thousands of creatures that dwell in the Eerie.

• After discovering there’s no other way to open it without putting the city at risk, Nightingale suggests asking the city’s rulers, Tyrial and Abigail, about the Aegis stone. Maybe they’ll have a way to get them past it without putting Greyhaven at risk.
• Zeke is upset to leave Justice behind, but after seeing how much the Maluma has worn Nightingale down, he reluctantly allows them to leave.
• ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership
• Damocles is forced to relive the night of his mother’s exposure to the Blight. He watches in lurid detail as his own failures lead to her exposure.
• She rots away before his eyes, forcing him to kill her and filling him with guilt over his failure to save her life.
• ! Flag Check: Coffin Buddy
• Rook wakes early into the morning to a jostling sound, and discovers Zeke has slipped away.
• He wakes the others, informing them that Zeke has probably gone off to rescue justice. The group is sure he can’t get through the Aegis stone, but he could get himself hurt.
• The group hastily packs their bags and hurries out after him.
• ! Special: Zeke is Unselectable
• ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

• Nightingale watches in horror as the Butcher decaipates Zafir before her eyes, butchering him in seconds. It turns on her, but before it can reach her Ezra and Brea arrive, fighting desperately to hold it back from Nightingale.

• Ezra urges Nightingale and the group to flee, reminding them that the Pontifex is all that matters. They use this opportunity to escape as quickly as they can, making it some distance before they find an empty chamber to rest in.
• The group discusses Zafir’s sacrifice. Damocles is unmoved by their deaths, while Remi is furious at the fate they suffered.
• Nightingale has a breakdown, believing that Damocles was right. All of Greyhaven was condemned because of her mercy. The city will die, the group will die, and it will be Nightingale’s fault.
• Zeke calms her down, though Nightingale remains grim.
• ! New Story Flag: Butchered
• ! Special: Zafir was killed

• The group is unwilling to give up, so rather than fight past the overwhelming monsters, they run wildly through the forest, dodging through dense foliage until they’re able to find another way around.
• Zeke reminds them that Justice is waiting, that there’s no time to rest and recover. They must fight on.
• Defeating the Shadow Lord is impossible, and it beats the party back with ease. Yet it hasn’t killed any of them yet, apparently intending to savor their deaths one by one.
• The Shadow Lord muses that it obviously needs to return to the surface, humans have grown complacent if they think they can fight powers greater than themselves.
• ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership AND A Helping Hand
• Tyrial notices the Anointed lurking in the corner of the room. Zafir introduces their group, and explains the dark gods they fight. Abigail and Tyrial clearly think they’re completely insane.
• When introductions are over, Nightingale explains their mission, and why they need to get into the Eerie.

• Tyrial insists this is impossible, explaining that the dragon-slaying mural on their wall depicts the way Lo and Ida obtained it in the first place. They had to travel the Middle Passage, make a pact with a demon, then enter Arkalla and kill a dragon within. It would be impossible to recreate their feat.
• There is no way to open the way into the Eerie. They ask Zeke if Justice would want to sacrifice the lives of everyone in the city to save herself. He admits that she wouldn’t.

• Zafir insists that it wouldn’t be Justice’s choice to make. Not getting her and the piece of the Pontifex back might mean the death for everyone in Elenia. Even sacrificing a city is a modest price to pay.
• Tyrial is outraged at the suggestion, and rejects the suggestion outright. Zafir stops arguing and submits quietly.
• Abigail tries to reassure Nightingale that they’ll feel better tomorrow, and might be able to figure out what to do then.
• ! Flag Check: Last of Her Cotorie
• ! Flag Check: Massacred
• Zeke’s persuasions ultimately win out and they agree to help the coffin to the surface.
• The group returns to inform it, and the coffin is grateful. It insists it knows the fastest way to the surface. The pixies drag it easily out the way they came.
• ! New Story Flag: Coffin Buddy
• After making it a little distance from the Eerie, Damocles attacks Echo, knocking her out in a single strike.

• Zafir and the Anointed turn, furious. Damocles is unrepentant, explaining that without the Shadow Lord around, the Soul Stitcher will return and make Echo violent again. Keeping her unconscious is the only way to keep her pacified.
• Zafir is unconvinced, and they nearly attack each other. Brea and Ezra hold him back, while Padric and Rook keep Damocles from fighting.
• Shayliss tells them all to shut up and threatens everyone with imprisonment who tries to get violent. Getting back to Greyhaven is the only thing that matters now.

• With the Shadow Lord gone, the Eerie seems to be collapsing around them, or at least his lair is. It’s a strain on all of them to escape intact. Eventually they reach the surface, and clamber out of the Eerie and into the light.
• The group collapses to rest, but Shayliss urges them onward. Greyhaven needs a warning, and they have to give it.
• ! Flag Check: A Helping Hand
• ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership
• ! Flag Check: A Greater Cause
• While trapped in the coffin, Remi sees a vision of her future. She’s become an assassin for the black hand, ruthless and powerful.

• She is on a mission to assassinate a powerful political target. But it’s personal for her. After killing everyone in her way, she reaches the bedroom of Princess Nightingale, last of the Arsen family. She’s been poisoned, but survives, forcing Remi to kill her herself.
• She tries to justify the murder to herself, but ultimately refuses to do it. Her real memories are too powerful to ignore.
• ! Flag Check: Coffin Buddy

• The group travels through the Eeriee, following the trails of blood deeper. The Maluma torments Nightingale, trying to get her to leave. She ignores it for some distance, until the creature manifests physically before everyone.

• Shayliss reacts with instant violence, but the Maluma is only a projection, and nothing happens. It explains they’ve reached the lair of the Shadow Lord. If they go further and they’re killed, their souls will be his forever.
• Nightingale mocks it, pointing out that the Maluma is only afraid because it too would be captured. They ignore it and continue on.

• The Maluma wasn’t lying, and soon they pass through a boundry into the Shadow Lord’s lair. The creature notices them instantly, manifesting as a faint projection. It admits that Justice is trapped in its lair, and they’ll never find her.
• When it’s finished mocking them the Shadow Lord vanishes, leaving them free to continue downward.
• ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership
• ! Flag Check: Massacred
• Shayliss answers instantly that none of this is their fault, and brings out Echo. She explains what happened, that Echo was the one who destroyed the stone.
• Tyrial appears, dragging Echo away to the dungeons. Damocles informs them of Echo’s dangerous Esper and her ability to come back to life.
• Zafir defends Echo, explaining that she was manipulated by the Esper, it wasn’t her decision. Tyrial doesn’t seem to care, and says that defending the city is all that matters. Her trial can wait.

• For a moment the group is stunned by their first sight of Greyhaven, a massive city with a palace floating in the sky above. It’s almost as big as Elenia, and the skies around them are filled with traffic.
• Remi learns the palace is called the Amaranthine, a fortress used by Lo and Ida when the ruins of the city were still overflowing with monsters.
• Even so, all the beauty could come crashing down if the city’s Float Core were destroyed, since they use the same magic as the airships, just much larger.

• Remi wants to explore the city, but Shayliss informs her that they won’t have time. Saving Justice is desperately urgent, and they’ll have to make her their first priority if they want to get to her in time.
• Zafir is forced to relive his years of happiness with Echo. They’re together again in safety, before Charon’s betrayal.
• The vision shifts as Echo confronts him about being abandoned, insisting that she’s been alive all this time and he didn’t care enough to save her.
• Zafir vows to do anything to get her back, but he’s tortured by visions of how she’s been alive and dead over and over again as she’s used as a puppet to do Charon’s bidding.
• ! Flag Check: Coffin Buddy
• The group wants to abandon Echo to her fate.
• Nightingale remembers her promise, and refuses to do so. She chides her friends, then charges into battle, forcing the others to follow.

• Zafir wakes screaming, overwhelmed by what he saw. Beside him is the broken coffin, which the group has hacked apart to finally get him free. Shayliss holds him down until he finally realizes what happened.
• The group explains how they were able to defeat the coffin and its Espers.

• Zafir shares that before the coffin was destroyed, he saw into its mind. He clearly connected the rescue of justice to the bloody trail on the ground. They need to follow it right away to reach her.
• ! Special: Zafir is no longer Unselectable
• Zafir wakes screaming, overwhelmed by what he saw. Shayliss holds him down until he finally realizes what happened.
• The group explains how he was captured, and how they found their way outside.
• ! Special: Zafir is no longer Unselectable
• Zafir is eager to accept the monster’s help. It’s going to escape anyway, and saving justice is their first priority.
• Brea the Anointed explains that the coffin is the receptacle for a soul, keeping the one inside safe from the Shadow Lord.
• Damocles agrees with Zafir, trying to persuade Nightingale and Shayliss to take the creature’s help.
• Shayliss explains that they weren’t the ones to destroy the Aegis stone, they went in to try and stop it.
• Abigail wants to know who it was, but Shayliss has to tell them that they’re already dead. Abigail is unhappy, apparently uninterested in revenge. All that matters is saving the city.
• Remi ends up at the front as they climb down into the Eerie, taking in the ancient, long-untouched geography of the place.
• Soon enough they’re past the reach of sunlight, in a maze of twisting passages. Now they have to navigate.
• ! Reward Check: Chalice of Manala
• Shayliss explains that they weren’t the ones to destroy the Aegis stone, they went in to try and stop it.
• Abigail wants to know who it was, and Shayliss explains that it was Zafir, and that he died for it. His death won’t help Greyhaven now.
• Tyrial urges them to return to planning the defense.
• The Coffin’s terrible power is beyond anything they can resist. It shows no mercy, slaughtering the group one at a time.
• Zeke is the last one left alive, watching as it finally advances on him.
• As he dies, his soul is pulled downward, to join the others trapped in torment. At least he finally finds Justice.
• Game Over

• No one would ever know what happened to Elenia’s princesses or their brave companions. In the end, stories would be told (incorrectly) of how they’d learned of the destroyed Aegis stone and gone down to hold off the hoards of monsters and protect Greyhaven.
• They failed here too, but at least their noble sacrifice would be remembered.
• GAME OVER

• Nightingale wakes in the cavern, mind still spinning from her vision. She’s left firmly remembering one thing above all others: the Maluma’s chief drive isn’t loyalty to Charon, it’s just staying on Middara.
• The coffin has been beaten to wreckage beside her, the fight finally won.
• Her friends help her to her feet, discovering that Nightingale is relatively unharmed from her experience. They get her back up to speed on what happened, and how they ended up outside.
• Nightingale explains that she briefly saw the memories of the coffin before it was destroyed. She’s sure the bloody trail is the key to finding Justice.
• ! Special: Nightingale is no longer Unselectable

• Nightingale wakes with the sun, mind still spinning from her vision. She’s left firmly remembering one thing above all others: the Maluma’s chief drive isn’t loyalty to Charon, it’s just staying on Middara.
• Her friends help her to her feet, discovering that Nightingale is relatively unharmed from her experience. They get her back up to speed on what happened, and how they ended up outside.
• ! Special: Nightingale is no longer Unselectable

• Rook’s vision while trapped inside the coffin is of his life on the farm. He’s returned to live with his parents, and they’re not alone. Suri is living with him, his wife after their time adventuring together.
• His peaceful vision is interrupted as they’re attacked by the Great Bounty. They’ve been tracked down at last.
• Rook tries to fight, but he’s forced to watch as his family is slaughtered. He tries in vain to free her, but he’s too weak, and Suri is taken back to Arkalla.
• ! Flag Check: Coffin Buddy
• Despite Zeke’s insistence, in the end the group refuses to assist the coffin. They hope to just leave it behind, and pray it gets lost on its way to the surface.
• The pixies react with fury to this news. Rather than taking the coffin and leaving, they instantly turn hostile, blocking off the exit.
• Terrible power reaches out from within the coffin, grabbing the nearest member of the group and dragging them in.
• ! Special: An Uninjured Adventurer is Unselectable
• Nightingale and Shayliss discuss their upcoming missions. Nightingale explains that the Maluma is keeping its word so far. She wants to know if Shayliss thinks they can really save Greyhaven.
• Shayliss says she’s heard the stories, and knows it’s possible. She promises that after they make it out of all this, Nightingale will be in the Demiurge for sure.
• Nightingale admits she hasn’t even thought about it in ages, though she does worry about Kufu. Now that she’s survived so much, she thinks the demiurge will probably be simple for her.

• The group returns to the throne room to discuss the battle for Greyhaven. It’s already going badly. These aren’t mindless monsters rampaging, they’ve been plotting their revenge for years. An evacuation is underway, but many will not be able to escape.

• There is only one way to save the city: reseal the Eerie with a new Aegis stone. They discuss the method used last time: a contract made with a demon, then the trip to Arkalla, and finally killing a dragon.
• During this impossible task, Greyhaven will be under siege. If the attackers reach the float core, the palace will fall and the city will be destroyed.
• Tyrial will fly to Castikoff for reinforcements while Abigail defends the city and protects the float core.
• ! Flag Check: Soul Judgement
• ! Flag Check: Last of her Coterie

• Rook discovers Ursy has climbed all the way up to the Crow’s nest, where she’s enjoying their flight with no regard for the dangers. After enjoying her perch for a few moments more, she agrees to join Rook back on the deck.

• Rook chides her for her dangerous choice, explaining that the Oppressor is taking the fastest but most dangerous route to Greyhaven, and that she needs to be somewhere safe in case they’re attacked.
• The Shadow Lord is far more powerful than it initially seems. Though they all fight together, it’s just too powerful. Soon they’re completely overwhelmed, and they’re about to die one at a time.

• Zafir calls out before that can happen, attracting the demigod’s attention. He asks the Shadow Lord to forgive Nightingale, that the attack was against his will, and they would like to ask for the initial offer. He will give up his life so the rest of them can leave.
• Nightingale tries to talk him out of making the choice, but he has made up his mind. The Shadow Lord kills him in front of everyone, giving them Justice in exchange.
• ! New Story Flag: A Greater Cause
• ! Special: Zafir has died
• The Coffin leads them the rest of the way to the surface, forcing them to follow all the way during the long hike up the canyon.
• Eventually they reach the surface. The Coffin is eager to be out, and at least it keeps its word. It explains that the way to find Justice is to follow the blood trails into the Shadow Lord’s lair.
• Shayliss doesn’t want to let the monster leave, but they’re running out of time. They can’t afford to waste time fighting it now.
• ! New Flag: Time is of the Essence
• All of them working together are finally able to kill the Butcher. Echo remains wounded, and the Stitcher is nowhere to be seen. Apparently it can’t reach here to repair her injuries.

• Damocles attacks her immediately, determined to kill her at last. Rook and Padric pull him off. Shayliss explains that all of Greyhaven have a right to justice from her as well, and that he’ll have to bide his time. They need all the help they can get to escape from the Shadow Lord alive.
• Echo agrees, explaining that she couldn’t possibly fight to the Shadow Lord on her own.
• They confiscate Echo’s weapons for the time being, after protest.
• Nightingale explains why they’re sparing her: she made a promise to Zafir and she intends to keep it.
• ! New Story Flag: A Helping Hand
• All of them working together are finally able to slay the Butcher.
• The Anointed use this moment of calm to treat Zafir’s wounds, giving him the last of their powerful potions to get him back on his feet.
• Shayliss seems willing to confront them right there, until the anointed point out how desperately bad their odds of survival are on their own.
• The rest of the group agrees, suggesting that Zafir can stand trial for destroying the Aegis stone after they escape.
• The Shadow Lord appears, hoping they’ll kill each other, but they refuse. It leaves them alone, confident they will find their deaths another way.
• ! New Story Flag: All We Can Get
• ! Special: Zafir is no longer Unselectable

• Shayliss points out that they still have to figure out what to do with Zafir. She believes he should be imprisoned for his actions, that he’s far too dangerous and he’s guilty of violence against the princess.
• Zafir counters that Nightingale is dying and that his help is too important. He knows Charon and its servants better than anyone.
• The Maluma wants Nightingale to get rid of him.
• ! Special: The party must decide to Lock the Anointed Up, or Let them Help
• Zafir informs everyone that him and the other Anointed can bring the barrier down with an hour of ritual magic. They’re ready to start right away.
• Shayliss responds in range, explaining the importance of the Aegis stone and the creatures that will be released to devour Greyhaven as soon as the stone is destroyed.
• Zafir doesn’t care if the city dies, since he believes that the world may perish if no one retrieves the Pontifex. He’s willing to sacrifice anything to cross.
• Nightingale demands that he stop, and reluctantly he agrees to come back with them to the Amaranthine.
• The Pixies warn the group not to touch anything, that the room is trapped for those who might find it, but not for them.

• They fly towards the huge coffin at the center, lifting it by its chains and dragging it out of the gold with surprising strength. The illusion of wealth vanishes, leaving them alone with the coffin. They say that the rescue is complete and now they can leave.

• Zeke wants to know how they’re saving their master if they’re already dead, before a voice echoes from within the coffin. A strange voice echoes from inside. At first it seems hostile, before the Pixies informs it that the group isn’t food, and that they’re on an important quest.
• Zeke says that in exchange for freeing them, he wants to know how to find Justice. The coffin promises that in exchange for their help escaping the lair, it will tell them how to find her.
• The group confers in private to discuss their options.
• ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership
• ! Flag Check: Massacred
• As they close in on Greyhaven, it’s clear that they’ve come too late. A wide trail of death leads straight to the city.
• When they finally arrive, their worst fears are confirmed. Fires burn as little battles rage all over. The sound of screaming citizens mingles with the roars of the monsters devouring them.

• Nightingale wants to help the citizens, but Shayliss stops her, reminding Nightingale that the group has been beaten to a pulp and doesn’t have the strength right now. They need to reach the Amaranthine and help organize the defense from there.

• A gigantic wurm emerges from the ground in front of them, smelling their blood. But before they can be devoured, a familiar airship arrives. Effie bombards the creature, sending it back underground and lowering a ladder for them. They climb aboard, ordering her to take them to the palace.

• The group asks that she stay close, that they might need her ship later. She pilots them down to the battlements and lets them off. Abigail is waiting there to confront them as soon as they disembark. She demands to know why they would’ve destroyed the
• ! Flag Check: Helping Hand
• ! Flag Check: Massacred
• ! Party Check: Is Zafir in the party?
• As soon as they make it a little distance from the Eerie, Nightingale hears a sharp crack, and turns around to discover that Damocles has struck Echo from behind, knocking her out cold.
• Shayliss is furious, and orders Damocles to carry her the rest of the way.
• Zeke hurries over to revive Justice, who eventually wakes. She wants to know how they got there. Zeke explains they had to trade someone’s life to get her back.
• Justice is furious with them, horrified at what they’ve done. She insists they take it back, but of course it’s too late.
• Nightingale explains that it was her choice to make the trade, despite everything.
• The Shadow Lord wishes Justice a surprisingly polite farewell. She doesn’t seem wounded, but her eyes are haunted and horrified whenever she looks at it.
• Zeke comforts her, ineffectively.

• Shayliss wakes on the floor beside the broken coffin, shaking off the memories of what she’s seen. Nightingale is there to greet her and help comfort her. Shayliss knows clearly what happened, and doesn’t need much of an explanation.
• The group catches her up on what happened while she was trapped, and the battle they had.
• Shayliss explains that before the creature was destroyed, she observed some of its memories. The bloody trail they saw earlier is the key to finding Justice.
• ! Special: Shayliss is no longer Unselectable

• Shayliss wakes outside, shaking off the memories of what she’s seen. Nightingale is there to greet her and help comfort her. Shayliss knows clearly what happened, and doesn’t need much of an explanation.
• The group catches her up on what happened while she was trapped, and how they got outside.
• ! Special: Shayliss is no longer Unselectable
• After some deliberation, Nightingale decides that Zafir can’t be trusted.
• Tyrial orders the Anointed to be imprisoned. They’re too dangerous to have around.
• ! New Story Flag: Imprisoned Anointed
• ! Special: Zafir has been imprisoned
• The group decides that the Shadow Lord is probably lying, and even if he isn’t who cares about Zafir? They decide not to go and save him.
• The Shadow Lord laughs, vanishing from before them.
• Damocles insists that they’re still on the right path, and they should be ignoring everything the Shadow Lord does.
